titleStmt.title: Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands (Freedmen's Bureau)

availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

org.orgName: Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands (Freedmen's Bureau)

body.p: Established by the U.S. War Department to supervise affairs relating to refugees, freedmen, and the custody of abandoned lands and property. Commissioner: Major General Oliver Otis Howard.

ab.bibl:
“African American Records: Freedmen’s Bureau,” The United States National Archives and Records Administration, https://www.archives.gov/research/african-americans/freedmens-bureau (accessed January 29, 2020).
"Records of the Assistant Commissioner for the State of North Carolina Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands, 1865-1870," The National Museum of African American History & Culture, https://nmaahc.si.edu/object/sova_nmaahc.fb.m843 (accessed March 24, 2020).
